columns.text: We are asked to calculate the value of a call option with an exercise price of $\$45$. Then, we will identify its intrinsic value using the given information.
**Call Option** is the right of an owner to purchase an asset at a fixed price during a specified time period.

**Valuing a call option** is calculated as follows:
$$\begin{align*}
C_0=S_0-\frac{E}{(1+R_f)}
\end{align*}$$

where
$$\begin{align*}
C_0&= \text{current value of call option}\\
S_0&= \text{Stock price}\\
E&= \text{Exercise price}\\
R_f&= \text{Risk-free rate}\\

\end{align*}$$

## Requirement a.

Let's begin by identifying the given amounts in a problem:



| |$\text{Amount}$ | 
|--|--| 
| $C_0$| | 
| $S_0$| $\$58$| 
| $E$| $\$45$| 
| $R_f$| $3.4\%$|

We will calculate the value of the call option with a given $\$45$ exercise price:

$$\begin{align*}
C_0&=S_0-\frac{E}{(1+R_f)}\\[15pt]
&=\$58-\frac{\$45}{(1+0.34)} &\\[15pt]
&=\$58-\$33.58  &\\[15pt]
&=\$24.42 &
\end{align*}$$
The value of the call option with a $\$45$ exercise price is $\$24.42$

We will find the intrinsic value.


The **intrinsic value** of an option is the lower bound of its value, or what the option would be worth if it were about to expire.

The lower bound is determined when:
$$\begin{align*}
C_0&\ge0 &\text{if }S_0-E<0 \\
C_0&\ge S_0-E &\text{if }S_0-E\ge0 
\end{align*}$$

We will calculate the intrinsic value:
$$\begin{align*}
S_0-E&=58-45\\
&=13
\end{align*}$$
Since $\$13> 0$, the intrinsic value is $\$24.42 \ge \$13$

## Requirement b.

Let's begin by identifying the given amounts in a problem:



| |$\text{Amount}$ | 
|--|--| 
| $C_0$| | 
| $S_0$| $\$58$| 
| $E$| $\$35$| 
| $R_f$| $3.4\%$|

We will calculate the value of the call option with a given $\$45$ exercise price:

$$\begin{align*}
C_0&=S_0-\frac{E}{(1+R_f)}\\[15pt]
&=\$58-\frac{\$35}{(1+0.34)} &\\[15pt]
&=\$58-\$26.12 &\\[15pt]
&=\$31.88 &
\end{align*}$$
The value of the call option with a $\$35$ exercise price is $\$31.88$

We will find the intrinsic value.


The **intrinsic value** of an option is the lower bound of its value, or what the option would be worth if it were about to expire.

The lower bound is determined when:
$$\begin{align*}
C_0&\ge0 &\text{if }S_0-E<0 \\
C_0&\ge S_0-E &\text{if }S_0-E\ge0 
\end{align*}$$

We will calculate the intrinsic value:
$$\begin{align*}
S_0-E&=58-35\\
&=23
\end{align*}$$
Since $\$23> 0$, the intrinsic value is $\$31.88 \ge \$23$
